Trial_Design.evidence: 157 patients undergoing laparoscopic major abdominal surgery were randomly assigned to two groups

Participants.evidence: 157 patients undergoing laparoscopic major abdominal surgery

Intervention.evidence: Remi (77, remifentanil) and OS (80, esketamine combined with dexmedetomidine)

Method_Outcome.evidence: The primary outcome was the numeric rating scale (NRS) pain score on postoperative day (POD)1.

Number_Randomised.evidence: 157 patients undergoing laparoscopic major abdominal surgery were randomly assigned to two groups

Result_Outcome.evidence: the NRS pain score and the proportion of rescue analgesia in Remi group was significantly higher than that in OS group (3 [1 to 3] vs 1 [1 to 3], P = 0.001; 15.6% vs 5.0%, P = 0.028, respectively)

Harms.evidence: the proportion of dreaminess was also higher than that in the Remi group (15.6% vs 42.5%, P < 0.01)
